Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon © 2001 by Linda Moulton Howe " And I saw a great white throne and the one who sat upon it, from whose face the earth and sky fled away, but they found no place to hide. I saw the dead, great and small, standi ng before God; and The Books were opened, including the Book of Life. And the de ad were judged according to the things wri tten i n The Books, each according to the d eeds he had done. ...And if anyone's name was not found recorded in the Book of Life, he was thrown into the Lake of Fire." The Revelation in the Bible 20:11-15 Second formation in wheat at Gog Magog Hills southeast of Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, England, reported on July 25, 2001. Second Crop Formation at Gog Magog Hills, Cambridge, England July 25, 2001:

Foreground wheat is second crop formation of July 25, 2001; evolving formation from July 11 to July 18 in background field, Cambridge, England. Aerial photograph © 2001 by Andrew King. Charles Mallett, CFPR Field Report, Gog & Magog Hills, Cambridgeshire July 25, 2001 : "Gog and Magog Hills have once again been chosen to receive a rather simple, but incredibly stunning crop circle event, this time of such majestic beauty and harmonious proportion that, for this writer, it's set far apart from the bulk of the English crop formations in 2001. ...(It is made of) two chunky crescents and a standing circle of wheat positioned within a flattened circle. Seventy-five thin paths of downed crop slice through the largest crescents with dramatic effect. From an aerial perspective this formation must be considered, without doubt, one of the finest of the season. 75 thin "rays" radiate from the ring around the thick crescent. Photograph © 2001 by Charles Mallett. "All the standing sections are placed within the outer circle with a precision that is beyond reproach. Throughout the whole formation that razor sharp look is consis tent to the degree of obsessive perfection.The floor construction is also extremely fluid and neat, very bouncy.

Upper crescent from which the 75 thin rays emanate. Photograph © 2001 by Charles Mallett. "At several locations within the laid crop areas there were poppy flowers in full bloom, standing out of the laid down stems of wheat, giving the whole formation a delicate yin flavor. This is interesting when one considers how fragile these flowers are, surely any mechanical device would have caused these plants huge trauma. To me it seems as if the agency involv ed in the creation of the real crop formations can be so effective and so subtle at their high craft that they can, with no problem, skirt around small flowers and other plants without causing any damage whatsoever. Poppy untouched by the force that created the Gog Magog H ills formation discovered July 25, 2001. Photograph © 2001 by Charles Mallett. "The thin paths through the larger crescent were amazing. Each one is approximately six inches wide and it looked as if they had been put down in the crop with great care and softness. The way this mature wheat was laid is also rather interesting. Down the length of each of the paths the crop has been whipped up from one side, it looked as if a small tube-wave had gone through, leaving the wheat gently brushed up one side of the wall of standing crop. This effect is consistent throughout all seventy-five avenues.

Top of crescents. Photograph © 2001 by Charles Mallett. "Also, this formation appears to be related to the huge circle just over the hill (in the field of the first formation at Gog Magog discussed in Part 1.) When I measured the July 25th formation's diameter, the tape pulled tight at exactly 237 feet. The amazing labyrinth within the July 11 huge ring measured exactly the same, 237 feet diameter. ...I left the formation in no doubt that the same circle making agency was responsible for the 666 feet ring, the maze and the square temple formation over the hill." Gog Magog Hills formation discovered on July 25, 2001. Aerial photograph © 2001 by Andrew King. http://www.cropcircleconnector.com http://www.temporarytemples.co.uk
